intro: Cycloptera annua, commonly known as the annual cycloptera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats such as fields and roadsides. Cycloptera annua is an herbaceous annual that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
